title: فرومان: الصين وأميركا وسباق الهيمنة على الذكاء الاصطناعي
summary: يرى المحلل الأميركي مايكل فرومان أن الصين ربما قد أصبحت مركز التصنيع للاقتصاد العالمي، ولكن الغرب يشعر ببعض الارتياح من التقييم بأن الولايات المتحدة تحتفظ بالريادة عندما يتعلق الأمر بالبحث عن الهيمنة في مجال الذكاء الاصطناعي.

title: Physicists are uncovering when nature’s strongest force falters
summary: The strong nuclear force may abruptly loosen its grip on the fundamental particles that make up matter at a special “critical point” – researchers are now getting a clearer picture of when that point is reached

title: Evolution of intelligence in our ancestors may have come at a cost
summary: By tracing when variations in the human genome first appeared, researchers have found that advances in cognitive abilities may have led to our vulnerability to mental illness

title: Electrons inside graphene have been pushed to supersonic speeds
summary: Making electrons flow like a liquid is difficult, but inside graphene researchers forced them to move so fast that they created dramatic shockwaves

title: Kids as young as 4 innately use sorting algorithms to solve problems
summary: It was previously thought that children younger than 7 couldn't find efficient solutions to complex problems, but new research suggests that much earlier, children can happen upon known sorting algorithms used by computer scientists

title: The best new science fiction books of October 2025
summary: Science fiction legend Ursula K. Le Guin is honoured with a new collection out this month, and sci-fi fans can also look forward to fiction from astronaut Chris Hadfield and award-winning authors Ken Liu and Mary Robinette Kowal

title: If you feel you don't really belong, here is some science-based advice
summary: Thinking you don’t fit in is agonising, whether you are starting at university or changing jobs. Our advice columnist, David Robson, shares some tips to change how you feel

title: How faster-than-light explosions could reveal the universe’s secrets
summary: Some things we see in space appear to outpace light. Now we are learning to harness these bizarre optical illusions to understand the mysteries of neutron stars, gamma ray bursts and more

title: The truth about narcissists: How to handle them, and can they change?
summary: Although narcissistic personality disorder is rarer than you might think, psychological research suggests it can come in two different types, one of which may be underdiagnosed
